title: Comprehensive First Aid Guide
introduction: Essential first aid knowledge for various injuries and medical emergencies .

sections.heading: Basic Wound Care
sections.content: Clean minor cuts with soap and water. Apply antiseptic and a sterile bandage. For deep wounds, apply direct pressure and seek immediate medical help.

sections.heading: Fractures and Sprains
sections.content: Immobilize the affected limb. Apply ice packs for swelling. Do not try to realign broken bones. Seek professional medical attention.

sections.heading: Burns (Thermal and Chemical)
sections.content: Cool burns with cool (not cold) running water for 10-20 minutes. Do not apply ice. For chemical burns, flush with plenty of water. Cover with sterile, non-fluffy dressing.

sections.heading: Controlling Bleeding:
sections.content: Apply direct pressure to the wound with a clean cloth or gauze until the bleeding stops. If the bleeding is severe, elevate the injured limb above the heart level.

disclaimer: This guide is for informational purposes only and does not replace professional medical advice.
